verses.roman:
tasmād indro 'bibhec chatror
vajraḥ pratihato yataḥ
kim idaṁ daiva-yogena
bhūtaṁ loka-vimohanam

synonyms: tasmāt—therefore; indraḥ—the King of heaven; abibhet—became very fearful; śatroḥ—from the enemy (Namuci); vajraḥ—the thunderbolt; pratihataḥ—was unable to hit and returned; yataḥ—because; kim idam—what is this; daiva-yogena—by some superior force; bhūtam—it has happened; loka-vimohanam—so wonderful to the people in general.
translation: When Indra saw the thunderbolt return from the enemy, he was very much afraid. He began to wonder whether this had happened because of some miraculous superior power.

purport.content: Indra's thunderbolt is invincible, and therefore when Indra saw that it had returned without doing any injury to Namuci, he was certainly very much afraid.
